p: Using a deep learning-based drug-target interaction model called molecular transformer-drug target interaction (MT-DTI), atazanavir, an analog of the peptide chain substrate approved for the treatment of HIV, has the potential to prevent the pro-form of SARS-CoV-2 proteins cleaving into the working form. In recent in vitro experiments, atazanavir inhibited SARS-CoV-2 replication and pro-inflammatory cytokines [ 14]. Clinical trials have been launched to evaluate its anti-SARS-CoV-2 effect [ 15].
